tweet: My mother lost her hearing in one ear from Polio when she was 15. It affected her whole life. It made her self conscious, less confident, and angry. It also made her #dementia worse. She said that people thought she was stupid because she couldn't hear. #DeafAwarenessWeek2021

tweet: Word salad, just like my Dad who had Dementia. It only gets worse. More lucid in the morning and declining as the day goes by. Sentences that are garbled or make no sense. This is not senility. Once you have dealt with a person that has dementia, it's easy to recognize in others.

Some people may not know this but i started writing because of my grandmother. When she got alzheimers a lot of things changed around my life and i didn't know how to express them until i learned how to write. I found this link from my old CV two of the stories here...

tweet:
So.

Sometime between 9pm, Friday, 7 May and 12 noon, Saturday, 8 May, my Dad suffered a hemorraghic stroke.  In PEI.

He was 83.

My mum, suffering from vascular dementia for 4 years, thought he was sleeping in.  When he wouldn't answer her, she got a neighbor.

I often cry for my mom throughout the day.  We worry.  We miss her.  We want to see her.  She cries & thinks we are punishing her.  She has Alzheimer‚Äôs & @LisaThompsonMPP @MichelleRempel @billwalkermpp @OntarioPCParty doesn‚Äôt care. üíî @AndreaHorwath @680NEWS

tweet:
So, my mom has dementia. Not bad yet, she's ok on her own for now. 
BUT as a middle-class boomer, not the savings for years in a good nursing home.
I want to be able to give her a place (of honor) in my home for as long as possible. 
Is that crazy?

Anant was the only child of his parents and the sole bread-winner for the family. 

His family includes his wife, parents and grandparents. 

His father suffers from Alzheimer's disease

tweet: dudes posting dubs page went from relatable sigma grindset to shit like "helping my alzheimers grandpa piss in the bedpan, we did it reddit!"

My grandmother died with Alzheimer's and COVID-19 which means her last moments, which were likely fully lucid, weren't with her loving husband, sons, daughter in laws, grandchildren, cousins, or niblings, but stuck on a ventilator, alone, until it was clear she couldn't recover.
Still finding unopened post from my dad‚Äôs office. He was more impaired by Alzheimers, for longer, than anyone realised. These letters are from May 2019.

@HoltPhili @OwdAlbert 62 or 3 Dad took my Mum from Buxton up to Oban on his scooter. Before dementia swallowed all her memories, she recalled him breaking their flask for much needed hot drinks because he insisted on hanging it from the handlebars.

It was an omen of many very bad decisions to come!

tweet:
To understand what it's like to have a parent with dementia.

My father was not one for violence or indeed conflict. 

He loathed any kind of violence.

Last week he smacked a nurse at the hospital. 

That's what dementia does. 

#DementiaActionWeek

When my father was 91 years old, deeply in to advanced Alzheimer‚Äôs, and clearly 6-9 months from death, his primary care doctor gave me an endless rash of shit over wanting to discontinue his statin.

The Hippocratic oath really should have a forest/trees clause.

I fully support animatronic/robot therapy pets! My aunt got one for my grandma for Mother‚Äôs Day, and it seems to release some of the pressure and emotions she isn‚Äôt able to express because of dementia. How odd that something completely fake can illicit the most genuine joy?
@KatTimpf Lost my mother to dementia 2 years ago, MD sucks

Happy mother's day, Granny. Thank you. Love you.

tweet: My mother was in aged care for 7 years. Generally she was fairly well cared for. She had dementia and in the end didn‚Äôt know us. Her death was harsh and we were lied to about the level of care she would be receive. Please sign this petition. careaboutagedcare.org.au

This video is so powerful and I can completely relate after me and my mum cared for my dad with late stage vascular dementia. The social care system needs to be urgently reviewed by the government to help carers in desperate need!

He may have made peace with that a long time ago, but the thing with making peace is that it comes with the assumption you're at the end of the story. But Mirage's brothers are gone. His mother suffers with what seems like dementia and he's all she can rely on. https://t.co/W4ivHKNkoF

@Lizparsons008 My mother worked with an older man who has Alzheimer's. Relatives sent him to a nursing home because it is dangerous for him to be alone and needs special care.

His relatives were allowed to take whatever we want, because now no one needs it.

tweet: Today has been hard. My dog has dementia and spends a lot of the day confused and staring at walls. He‚Äôs anxious because he is confused and no comfort from me helps. My son is worried about death and time passage and no words from me comfort him. I hope tomorrow is better.

My parents were with us but all of our family members, fell cronized and my elder brother took them back to our ancestral home at Bhera, Sargodha. I can never ever have thought that I would not be with him on such critical time. But, dementia occurrence in him took him away.

This is the reality of dementia. My diamond, my heart, my mother. She is still in there, we still connect. The Bumps, the falls, but still there in moments of clarity. Breaks my heart. #dementia #alzheimers #dementiaawareness
instagram.com/p/CO3m44HnG1C/‚Ä¶

@KathleenLipins6 @Jessrocks71 My Mom 85 has Dementia. I do all the cooking, she moved in with me. I never have followed recipes. Imagination is my recipe! Fresh spices is a key! I never worked as a cook. The mom says I have a oldest son that  can cook, my two daughters can't boil water!

tweet:
"It doesn't matter what you bear, but how you bear it." -Seneca  
When it comes to my mother's Alzheimer's, the only thing I can control is my focus. Once it shifted to my love for her, for my family, and once I embraced the idea of impermanence, grief was unable to cripple me.

My grandfather has struggled with Alzheimer's and dementia for as long as I have known him. His episodes throughout my childhood has been painful to watch.

He is bedridden now, unable to speak or move.

I just finished watching The Father this evening, and my heart is broken.

My great grandmother passed away earlier today.

How to Help Seniors with Memory Loss

Is your senior parent suffering from dementia or Alzheimer's? Do they often feel disoriented or have the urge to wander? Place stop signs on your gates or front doors to help your senior parents remember.

tweet:
I learned Saturday that my grandpa (father's father) apparently has Alzheimer's, pretty advanced state. I haven't seen him in a looong time, but he was very dear to me when I was younger, and did a lot for me.
I can't remember the last time I said that I loved him.

2021:
- mom falls down the stairs & is now disabled & w/ onset dementia

- dad passed away

- mom‚Äôs dog we are now taking care of, has a seizure (now recovering nicely)

- I rupture a muscle in my leg, unable to walk,  sequesteredto  living room couch for 3 weeks

...still sober.

tweet:
Today is my grandma‚Äôs birthday: 

She‚Äôs 92 years old

Last year, I spent 2 months w/ her because I wasn‚Äôt sure she was gonna make it through the holidays, but God gave her more life

The sad thing is she has Dementia and doesn‚Äôt always remember me

Tell your family you love them

@AvaRBF We had to place my mom at age 90 in 2016. Mid-stage Alzheimer‚Äôs and I could no longer adequately care for her. It was a family decision mostly to save MY life because it was killing me. I had all legal, financial and medical POA for her. It was a heart-wrenching decision.

@mcsoaz @Arizona_Rangers My grandmother had Alzheimer's.

One day, while living with us, she decides to get in her car and try to drive back to her home that we sold a year ago.

Home's in a totally different state.

Get a phone call in the middle of the night.

She's lost, in the middle of nowhere.

tweet: On Mother's Day I asked my family to watch The Sound of Music with me. It had been about 18 years since I'd seen it; my grandmother watched it at least once a day when she had Alzheimer's and by the time she died I was so sick of it I couldn't imagine watching it again.

Happy mother's day to all the mothers out there! This will be the second mother's day without my mother, Judy, after we lost her to Alzheimer's.

I wish I could've learned more from you, and even if we didn't always see eye to eye I know it wasn't easy...

tweet:
I went through a recovery program for 4 months, impossible before covid.
I've begun work on a series of graphic novellas using hand-drafting skills from college.
I moved closer to my parents to help with my grandfather in early stage Alzheimers.
None of that was possible before.

Lately I'm experiencing some difficulties in managing switching to different languages while talking.
I truly thought I'm facing early dementia üòî like my dad.  
Today I had a business zoom where everything went fantastic.. I did great.  
I hope it's not temporary...I'm üò®

"We became involved with CarePartners right after my dad passed away. It's helped a lot, because not only is she dealing with the Alzheimer's but she's dealing with grieving for my dad, so having the people at the Gathering Place events has been huge."
carepartnerstexas.org/annualfund/ https://t.co/hF2wbVlFeB

@Christhevamp My grandmother has a new phone number I haven't memorized, but her old one will be in my heart forever.**

**(at least until I get dementia).
